head.title: Journal of a Passage in a Canoe from Pais Plat in Lake Superior to Portage de l'Isle in River Ouinipique, 1784. - Page #17

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #17 of 32 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Umfreville, Edward. Journal of a Passage in a Canoe from Pais Plat in Lake Superior to Portage de l'Isle in River Ouinipique, 1784. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0030

div.p: des Bouleaux, (here is a stony Strait which discharges into the adjoining lac) wch is 180yds over a good road. From the Port. entd a lac in which turn'd immediately to ye Lt & coasted along shore ½ m. to a pt many Is on Rt[.] From the pt Travers'd over the lac SWbW3m. to a pt leaving a small Isld of Pine Trees on ye Rt – from this pt cross'd to a Channel like a Creek grassy on each side – went in it ½ m. to Port de la Presse 195yds over a good road – then a small lac abt 60yds wide to a narrow grassy Channel, went in it 1½ m. to a lac, which we cross'd SSW2½ m. to a pt a wide opening on Rt & 2 small Islds before it & a bay on Lt – went rod ye pt to a wide Channel, went along ye Rt side of it SW. when it opens into a lac, cross'd it SW3m. passing a small Id on the Rt & a deep bay on Lt near the end of the Co – then ent'd a narrow Channel[,] went in it[,] in fine deep water with wild rice on each side 2½ m. – then entd a lac went in it SWbW3m. to a pt sevl Is & deep bay on Lt pass'd near a pt of the main on the Rt & a small Isle on Lt – turn'd rod ye pt & ent'd a broad Channel Co in it WbS1m. to a pt of Grass on the Rt being a neck which leads into lac à la Presse, turnd upon the Rt & went WNW2½, having 2 small Isles on ye Lt & an old Press on a sandy beach, & a bay upon the Rt – this Co goes to the 1st I. on the Rt laying at the mo of a wide branch of the lac which turns off to the Rt – after leaving the Island NEbE2m. to a rocky point on Lt keeping sevl islands on the Rt – turn'd rod the rocky point & went WNW1¼ in a broad Channel to a pt on Lt – at the end of this Co the Channel is narrower, & turns off Westerly into a small lac, went NWbN2m. between 2 isles on Lt & the main on Rt – this brought us to the mouth of Riviere de Monataggè, wch is stony at the mouth, & has a little Id laying at its entrance, went in it down an easy Currt No1m. to a Rapid being Port. de dètour (named by St Germaine) 102yds over a good road on Lt side, shot the Rapid with ye major part of the Goods in ye Canoe & carried ye remainder, then went WSW1½m. to a pt at the bottom of this rapid a lac with islands – turn'd rod 1st pt on Lt & went WSW1½ to a pt on Lt having 2 small islands on the Lt & 2 do & a bay on Rt – then SW¼[.] In the river SWbW1m. WSW1 Wt ½m. to a Rapid, shot down the Rt hand side after a few pieces were taken out. Port. was named la Batture by our men 250yds over (wants clearing) WNW1m. in a lac having Islds on Rt & Lt 3 channs appear on the Rt entd the 3d NNW¾ from the beginning of the Channel to a pt on Lt the lac on ye Rt – from the pt No¾ to a Rapid here are 2 channels, went down the Lt the beginning of wch is shallow & stony bottom, men debark'd & led ye Canoe down it abt 30yds – then abt 100yds to another Rapid abt 150yds long at the end of which Port. de l'Isle 180yds over a good road – (NB whe[n] the water is low, they pass by another Port. wch the Guide says is ½ league over) – from the end of the Port. by the Isle, over a short shoal of large stones near ½m. to a rapid at the end of the Rapid Isle, which we pass'd on our Rt – then went near ½m. to a rapi[d] wch ye Canoe pass'd with half its lading, carried the rest over the Port. which is on the Rt side 190yds over & named by our men Port. de deux Rapids.

July 13 Tuesday. From the Port. went abt ¼ among Stones & strong Currt – then turn'd to ye Rt leaving a swampy Channel behind us – ¼m. farther another Rapid shot it easily having plenty of water, near ¼m. to another or rather two, but a short diste

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
